title: LDAP Server NULL Bind Connection Information Disclosure
content:
Description:
The remote LDAP server allows anonymous access
References
https://www.tenable.com/plugins/nessus/10723
https://ldap.com/ldapv3-wire-protocol-reference-bind
Impact
information disclosure
System Host(s)
████
Affected Product(s) and Version(s)
CVE Numbers
Steps to Reproduce
run $ nmap -n -sV --script "ldap* and not brute" -p 389 ██████████
check the response
## POC
██████
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Configure the service to disallow NULL BINDs.
vuln_description: The remote LDAP server allows anonymous access via NULL Bind, which can lead to information disclosure. This means an attacker can connect to the LDAP server without authentication and potentially retrieve sensitive information.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover using a standard Nmap script. It does not involve multiple components, complex interactions, or novel logic. The attack is simple and well-documented in public references.
